summary.span: 表示一个时间间隔。

span.span: Represents a time interval.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A对象表示为正或负的天数、 小时、 分钟、 秒和秒的小数数字度量时间间隔内 （持续时间的时间或时间）。A object represents a time interval (duration of time or elapsed time) that is measured as a positive or negative number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and fractions of a second. 结构还可以用于表示一天，但仅的时间，如果特定日期与不相关的时间。The structure can also be used to represent the time of day, but only if the time is unrelated to a particular date. 否则为或应改为使用结构。Otherwise, the or structure should be used instead. (有关使用结构，以反映的当天的时间，请参阅[选择之间 DateTime、 DateTimeOffset、 TimeSpan 和 TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md)。)(For more information about using the structure to reflect the time of day, see [Choosing Between DateTime, DateTimeOffset, TimeSpan, and TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md).) > [!NOTE] > A值表示时间间隔，并且可以表示为特定数目的天数、 小时、 分钟、 秒和毫秒。A value represents a time interval and can be expressed as a particular number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds. 因为它代表无需对某个特定的开始或结束点引用常规间隔，则不能将其表示年和月，这两种具有可变数量的天数方面。Because it represents a general interval without reference to a particular start or end point, it cannot be expressed in terms of years and months, both of which have a variable number of days. 它不同于值，该值表示的日期和时间而不引用特定时区，或值，该值表示特定时刻的时间。It differs from a value, which represents a date and time without reference to a particular time zone, or a value, which represents a specific moment of time. 最大单元时间结构使用的度量持续时间为一天。The largest unit of time that the structure uses to measure duration is a day. 时间间隔测量以天为单位的一致性，因为更大的单位的时间，例如月和年中的天数而异。Time intervals are measured in days for consistency, because the number of days in larger units of time, such as months and years, varies. 值对象是等于表示的时间间隔的计时周期数。The value of a object is the number of ticks that equal the represented time interval. 刻度等于 100 纳秒或秒的一千万分之一。A tick is equal to 100 nanoseconds, or one ten-millionth of a second. 值对象的范围可以从到。The value of a object can range from to . ## 实例化一个 TimeSpan 值Instantiating a TimeSpan Value 可以实例化多种方式的值：You can instantiate a value in a number of ways: - 通过调用其隐式的默认构造函数。By calling its implicit default constructor. 这将创建一个对象，其值是，如下面的示例所示。This creates an object whose value is , as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#2)] - 通过调用其显式构造函数之一。By calling one of its explicit constructors. 下面的示例初始化为指定的小时数、 分钟和秒数的值。The following example initializes a value to a specified number of hours, minutes, and seconds. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#3)] - 通过调用的方法或执行返回的操作值。By calling a method or performing an operation that returns a value. 例如，你可以实例化表示两个日期和时间值，如以下示例所示之间间隔的值。For example, you can instantiate a value that represents the interval between two date and time values, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#4)] 也可以初始化为这种方式，如以下示例所示零时间值的对象。You can also initialize a object to a zero time value in this way, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/zero1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/zero1.vb#6)] 算术运算符和方法的返回值， ，和结构。 values are returned by arithmetic operators and methods of the , , and structures. - 通过分析的字符串表示形式值。By parsing the string representation of a value. 你可以使用和方法用于将包含到的时间间隔的字符串转换值。You can use the and methods to convert strings that contain time intervals to values. 下面的示例使用方法将转换的字符串转换为数组值。The following example uses the method to convert an array of strings to values. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#5)] 此外，可以定义要进行解析并转换到的输入字符串的确切格式值通过调用或方法。In addition, you can define the precise format of the input string to be parsed and converted to a value by calling the or method. ## 执行时间跨度值的操作Performing Operations on TimeSpan Values 你可以添加或减少持续时间通过使用和运算符，或通过调用和方法。You can add and subtract time durations either by using the and operators, or by calling the and methods. 你还可以通过调用来比较两个时间段， ，和方法。You can also compare two time durations by calling the , , and methods. 结构还包含和方法，将时间间隔转换为正值和负值，The structure also includes the and methods, which convert time intervals to positive and negative values, 范围值是到。The range of values is to . ## 时间跨度值进行格式设置Formatting a TimeSpan Value A值可以表示为 [*-*]*d*。*hh*:*mm*:*ss*。*ff*，其中可选负号指示负时间间隔， *d*分量表示天， *hh*表示小时采用 24 小时制， *mm*为分钟， *ss*为秒，和*ff*为秒小数部分的第二个。A value can be represented as [*-*]*d*.*hh*:*mm*:*ss*.*ff*, where the optional minus sign indicates a negative time interval, the *d* component is days, *hh* is hours as measured on a 24-hour clock, *mm* is minutes, *ss* is seconds, and *ff* is fractions of a second. 也就是说，时间间隔由正负数天不一天的时间的情况下或数天时间或仅一天的时间组成。That is, a time interval consists of a positive or negative number of days without a time of day, or a number of days with a time of day, or only a time of day. 开头[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]、结构支持区分区域性的格式设置的重载通过其方法，后者将转换为其字符串表示形式的值。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the structure supports culture-sensitive formatting through the overloads of its method, which converts a value to its string representation. 默认值方法返回一个时间间隔使用固定格式与在以前版本的.NET Framework 其返回值相同。The default method returns a time interval by using an invariant format that is identical to its return value in previous versions of the .NET Framework. 重载允许您指定一个定义的字符串表示形式的时间间隔的格式字符串。The overload lets you specify a format string that defines the string representation of the time interval. 重载允许你指定一个格式字符串和其格式设置约定用于创建的字符串表示形式的时间间隔的区域性。The overload lets you specify a format string and the culture whose formatting conventions are used to create the string representation of the time interval. 支持这两个标准和自定义格式字符串。 supports both standard and custom format strings. (有关详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。)但是，只有标准格式字符串是区分区域性的。(For more information, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md).) However, only standard format strings are culture-sensitive. ## 还原旧时间跨度格式设置Restoring Legacy TimeSpan Formatting 在某些情况下，代码，它成功格式中值[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]和早期版本中出现故障[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]。In some cases, code that successfully formats values in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions fails in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. 这是最常见的调用的代码[< TimeSpan_LegacyFormatMode > 元素](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md)方法来设置格式使用格式字符串的值。This is most common in code that calls a [ element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md) method to format a value with a format string. 下面的示例成功设置中的值[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]和早期版本中，但引发异常[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]及更高版本。The following example successfully formats a value in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions, but throws an exception in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] and later versions. 请注意，它会尝试设置的格式值，通过使用不受支持的格式说明符，它在中忽略[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]及更早版本。Note that it attempts to format a value by using an unsupported format specifier, which is ignored in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.Legacy#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.legacy/cs/legacycode1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.Legacy#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.legacy/vb/legacycode1.vb#1)] 如果你不能修改代码，则可以还原的旧格式中通过以下方式之一的值：If you cannot modify the code, you can restore the legacy formatting of values in one of the following ways: - 创建配置文件来包含[< TimeSpan_LegacyFormatMode > 元素](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md)。By creating a configuration file that contains the [ element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md). 设置此元素的`enabled`属性设为`true`还原旧每个应用程序进行格式设置。Setting this element's `enabled` attribute to `true` restores legacy formatting on a per-application basis. - 通过设置"NetFx40_TimeSpanLegacyFormatMode"兼容性当你创建应用程序域时切换。By setting the "NetFx40_TimeSpanLegacyFormatMode" compatibility switch when you create an application domain. 这将启用旧基于每个应用程序域格式设置。This enables legacy formatting on a per-application-domain basis. 下面的示例创建的应用程序域中使用旧格式设置。The following example creates an application domain that uses legacy formatting. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/cs/perappdomain1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/vb/perappdomain1.vb#1)] 当新的应用程序域中执行下面的代码时，它将恢复到旧格式设置行为。When the following code executes in the new application domain, it reverts to legacy formatting behavior. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/cs/showtimespan.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/vb/showtimespan.vb#2)] ## Examples 下面的示例实例化表示两个日期之间的差异的对象。The following example instantiates a object that represents the difference between two dates. 然后，它显示对象的属性。It then displays the object's properties. remarks.format: ## Remarks A值可以表示为 [*-*]*d*。*hh*:*mm*:*ss*。*ff*，其中可选负号指示负时间间隔， *d*分量表示天， *hh*表示小时采用 24 小时制， *mm*为分钟， *ss*为秒，和*ff*为秒小数部分的第二个。A value can be represented as [*-*]*d*.*hh*:*mm*:*ss*.*ff*, where the optional minus sign indicates a negative time interval, the *d* component is days, *hh* is hours as measured on a 24-hour clock, *mm* is minutes, *ss* is seconds, and *ff* is fractions of a second. 值属性是日组成部分， *d*。The value of the property is the day component, *d*. 属性表示整个天，而属性表示整数和小数部分组成的天数。The property represents whole days, whereas the property represents whole and fractional days. ## Examples 下面的示例创建几个对象，并显示每个属性。The following example creates several objects and displays the property of each. remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`参数包含一个时间间隔规范形式：The `s` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*] [-] { *d* | [*d*。]*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | [*d*.]*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 一个从列表中选择的替代项括在大括号 （{和}） 和由竖线分隔 (|) 是必需的。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表描述每个元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |-|可选的负号，指示负。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|范围从 0 到 10675199 天。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |..|小时分隔天区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|小时数，范围从 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|区分区域性的时间分隔符符号。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 固定格式使用冒号 (":") 字符。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分钟数，范围从 0 到 59。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|可选的秒，范围从 0 到 59。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*.**.*|分数 （竖式） 的第二个分离开来秒区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|可选秒的小数部分包含 1 到 7 十进制数字。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 如果`s`参数不是日期值，它必须包含小时数和分钟数部分; 其他组件是可选的。If the `s` argument is not a day value only, it must include an hours and a minutes component; other components are optional. 如果存在，每个时间组件的值必须在指定的范围内。If they are present, the values of each time component must fall within a specified range. 例如，值为*hh*，小时数部分中，必须是介于 0 和 23 之间。For example, the value of *hh*, the hours component, must be between 0 and 23. 由于此，传递"23: 00:00"到方法返回 23 个小时的时间间隔。Because of this, passing "23:00:00" to the method returns a time interval of 23 hours. 另一方面，传递"24: 00:00"返回的时间间隔为 24 天。On the other hand, passing "24:00:00" returns a time interval of 24 days. "24"不在范围之内的小时数部分，因为它被解释为的天数部分。Because "24" is outside the range of the hours component, it is interpreted as the days component. 组件`s`必须共同指定大于或等于的时间间隔且小于或等于。The components of `s` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法尝试分析`s`通过每个区域性特定的格式用于当前区域性。The method tries to parse `s` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the current culture. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将转换为字符串数组中的每个元素值。The following example uses the method to convert each element in a string array to a value. 它更改为克罗地亚语-克罗地亚 ("HR-HR") 和英语-美国境内 ("EN-US") 以说明当前系统区域性如何影响在分析操作的当前系统区域性。It changes the current system culture to Croatian - Croatia ("hr-HR") and English - United States ("en-US") to illustrate how the current system culture affects the parsing operation. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/cs/parse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/vb/parse1.vb#1)]

当时间间隔组件要分析的字符串中包含多个七个数字，分析操作中的[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]早期版本的分析中的操作行为可能也会有所不同[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]。When a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations in the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions may behave differently from parsing operations in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. 在某些情况下，分析操作中，在成功[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]和早期版本可能失败并引发中[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]。In some cases, parsing operations that succeed in the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. 在其他情况下，分析操作中引发中[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]和早期版本可能失败并引发中[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]。In other cases, parsing operations that throw a in the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. 下面的示例阐释了这两种方案。The following example illustrates both scenarios.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `input`参数包含一个时间间隔规范形式：The `input` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*] [-] { *d* | [*d*。]*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | [*d*.]*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括号 （[和]） 是可选的; 中的元素一个从列表中选择的替代项括在大括号 （{和}） 和由竖线分隔 (|) 是必需的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional; one selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表描述每个元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |-|可选的负号，指示负。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|范围从 0 到 10675199 天。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |..|小时分隔天区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 默认值为句点 ("。") 字符。The default value is a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|小时数，范围从 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|区分区域性的时间分隔符符号。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol.| |*mm**mm*|分钟数，范围从 0 到 59。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|可选的秒，范围从 0 到 59。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |..|分数 （竖式） 的第二个分离开来秒区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 默认值为句点 ("。") 字符。The default value is a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|可选秒的小数部分包含 1 到 7 十进制数字。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 如果`input`参数不是日期值，它必须包含小时数和分钟数部分; 其他组件是可选的。If the `input` argument is not a day value only, it must include an hours and a minutes component; other components are optional. 如果存在，每个时间组件的值必须在指定的范围内。If they are present, the values of each time component must fall within a specified range. 例如，值为*hh*，小时数部分中，必须是介于 0 和 23 之间。For example, the value of *hh*, the hours component, must be between 0 and 23. 由于此，传递"23: 00:00"到方法返回 23 个小时的时间间隔。Because of this, passing "23:00:00" to the method returns a time interval of 23 hours. 另一方面，传递"24: 00:00"返回的时间间隔为 24 天。On the other hand, passing "24:00:00" returns a time interval of 24 days. "24"不在范围之内的小时数部分，因为它被解释为的天数部分。Because "24" is outside the range of the hours component, it is interpreted as the days component. 组件`input`必须共同指定大于或等于的时间间隔且小于或等于。The components of `input` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法尝试分析`input`通过每个区域性特定的格式用于指定的区域性`formatProvider`。The method tries to parse `input` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the culture specified by `formatProvider`. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供返回字符串的格式的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A对象，用于定义返回字符串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、使用与当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个数组对象，并在调用中使用每个对象方法，以便分析的字符串数组中的元素。The following example defines an array of objects, and uses each object in calls to the method to parse the elements in a string array. 该示例说明如何特定区域性的约定影响格式设置操作。The example illustrates how the conventions of a specific culture influence the formatting operation. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析的时间间隔，它必须是定义的格式的字符串表示`format`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 因为`input`必须符合的格式`format`完全匹配，你应始终使用异常处理时将用户的字符串输入转换为时间间隔。Because `input` must conform to the format of `format` exactly, you should always use exception handling when converting a string input by the user to a time interval. 如果你不希望使用异常处理，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to use exception handling, you can call the method instead. `format`参数是一个字符串，包含单个标准格式说明符或一个或多个定义的所需的格式的自定义格式说明符`input`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法使用由指定的区域性的约定`formatProvider`仅当`format`是一种标准字符串设置其值为"g"或"G"格式。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if `format` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义的输入字符串的确切格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔内的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供返回字符串的格式的区域性特定信息，如果`format`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A对象，用于定义返回字符串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、使用与当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法，以便分析的时间间隔使用各种格式字符串和区域性的多个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义的输入字符串的确切格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔内的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供返回字符串的格式的区域性特定信息，如果格式字符串用于分析`input`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A对象，用于定义返回字符串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、使用与当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法将转换到的字符串数组的每个元素值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 该示例解释使用法语-法国 ("FR-FR") 区域性的格式设置约定的字符串。The example interprets the strings using the formatting conventions of the French - France ("fr-FR") culture. 字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规长格式的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，该示例更改时间间隔分析方法在其中解释有一位数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，有一位数字解释为时间间隔的天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h`自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为的小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 有关此更改后才能生效，请注意，`%h`自定义格式字符串必须位于之前中的其他格式字符串`formats`数组。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义的输入字符串的确切格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔内的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供返回字符串的格式的区域性特定信息，如果格式字符串用于分析`input`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A对象，用于定义返回字符串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、使用与当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`参数会影响使用自定义格式字符串分析的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否`input`负号存在时才被解释为负时间间隔 ()，或是否始终解释为负时间间隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用，`format`必须包含文本的负号符号 (如"\\-") 为成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法将转换到的字符串数组的每个元素值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规长格式的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，该示例更改时间间隔分析方法在其中解释有一位数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，有一位数字解释为时间间隔的天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h`自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为的小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 有关此更改后才能生效，请注意，`%h`自定义格式字符串必须位于之前中的其他格式字符串`formats`数组。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. 另请注意从输出的仅在使用此格式说明符分析字符串时，才使用方法调用中指定的标志。Also note from the output that the flag specified in the method call is used only when parsing a string with this format specifier. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.ParseExact#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parseexact/cs/parseexactexample4.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.ParseExact#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parseexact/vb/parseexactexample4.vb#4)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks A值可以表示为 [*-*]*d*。*hh*:*mm*:*ss*。*ff*，其中可选负号指示负时间间隔， *d*分量表示天， *hh*表示小时采用 24 小时制， *mm*为分钟， *ss*为秒，和*ff*为秒小数部分的第二个。A value can be represented as [*-*]*d*.*hh*:*mm*:*ss*.*ff*, where the optional minus sign indicates a negative time interval, the *d* component is days, *hh* is hours as measured on a 24-hour clock, *mm* is minutes, *ss* is seconds, and *ff* is fractions of a second. 值属性是秒组成部分， *ss*。The value of the property is the seconds component, *ss*. 属性表示整秒数，而属性表示整数和小数部分组成的秒数。The property represents whole seconds, whereas the property represents whole and fractional seconds. ## Examples 下面的示例创建几个对象，并显示每个属性。The following example creates several objects and displays the property of each. summary.span: 将当前 对象的值转换为其等效的字符串表示形式。

span.span: Converts the value of the current object to its equivalent string representation.

returns.span: 当前 值的字符串表示形式。

span.span: The string representation of the current value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回的字符串"c"格式说明符进行格式设置，并且具有以下格式：The returned string is formatted with the "c" format specifier and has the following format: [-][*d*.]*hh*:*mm*:*ss*[.*fffffff*][-][*d*.]*hh*:*mm*:*ss*[.*fffffff*] 元素在方括号 （[和]） 可能不包括在返回的字符串。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) may not be included in the returned string. 冒号和句号 (: and。) 是原义字符。Colons and periods (: and.) are literal characters. 下表中列出的非文本元素。The non-literal elements are listed in the following table. 请注意，返回的字符串方法不是区分区域性的。Note that the string returned by the method is not culture-sensitive. |项Item|描述Description| |----------|-----------------| |"-""-"|减号，指示负时间间隔。A minus sign, which indicates a negative time interval. 没有迹象是为了让正时间跨度。No sign is included for a positive time span.| |"*d*""*d*"|中的时间间隔的天数数。The number of days in the time interval. 如果对于小于一天的时间间隔，则忽略此元素。This element is omitted if the time interval is less than one day.| |"*hh*""*hh*"|中的时间间隔，范围从 0 到 23 小时数。The number of hours in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 23.| |"*mm*""*mm*"|中的时间间隔，范围从 0 到 59 分钟数。The number of minutes in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 59.| |"*ss*""*ss*"|在从 0 到 59 之间的时间间隔的秒数。The number of seconds in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 59.| |"*fffffff*""*fffffff*"|中的时间间隔的秒小数部分。Fractional seconds in the time interval. 如果时间间隔不包括秒的小数部分，则忽略此元素。This element is omitted if the time interval does not include fractional seconds. 如果存在，则始终使用七个十进制数字表示秒的小数部分。If present, fractional seconds are always expressed using seven decimal digits.| > [!NOTE] > 有关比较的字符串表示形式和 Oracle 数据类型，请参阅知识库文章[324577: System.TimeSpan 不匹配 Oracle 9i INTERVAL DAY TO 第二个数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=161146)。For more information about comparing the string representation of and Oracle data types, see Knowledge Base article [324577: System.TimeSpan Does Not Match Oracle 9i INTERVAL DAY TO SECOND Data Type](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=161146). ## Examples 下面的示例显示通过调用返回的字符串方法与大量的值。The following example displays the strings returned by calling the method with a number of values. 请注意，尽管该示例不调用方法直接，它由调用方法尝试转换时为其字符串表示形式的值。Note that although the example does not call the method directly, it is called by the method when it attempts to convert a value to its string representation. remarks.format: ## Remarks `format`参数可以是任何有效的标准或自定义格式说明符值。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard or custom format specifier for values. 如果`format`等同于或`null`，当前的返回值常见的格式说明符 ("c") 进行格式设置对象。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the common format specifier ("c"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，该方法将引发。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . 如果`format`是标准格式字符串，返回字符串的格式由当前区域性的格式设置约定定义。If `format` is a standard format string, the format of the returned string is defined by the formatting conventions of the current culture. > [!IMPORTANT] > 自定义格式字符串为值不包括日期或时间分隔符。The custom format strings for values do not include a date or time separator. 如果你想要在格式字符串中包含这些元素，你必须将它们视为字符文本。If you want to include these elements in your format string, you must treat them as character literals. 查看有关说明，示例和查看[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)有关详细信息的主题。See the example for an illustration, and see the [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md) topic for more information. .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关详细信息的格式字符串有关值，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about format strings for values, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). - 有关.NET Framework 中的格式设置支持的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). ## Examples 下面的示例使用标准和自定义格式字符串的数组中显示的字符串表示形式的每个元素值The following example uses standard and custom format strings to display the string representation of each element in an array of values [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/cs/tostring3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/vb/tostring3.vb#3)]

A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 所返回的对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object retuned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像是方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `s`参数包含一个时间间隔规范形式：The `s` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*] [-] { *d* | *d*。*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | *d*.*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 一个从列表中选择的替代项括在大括号 （{和}） 和由竖线分隔 (|) 是必需的。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表描述每个元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |-|可选的负号，指示负。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|范围从 0 到 10675199 天。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |..|小时分隔天区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|小时数，范围从 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|区分区域性的时间分隔符符号。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 固定格式使用冒号 (":") 字符。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分钟数，范围从 0 到 59。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|可选的秒，范围从 0 到 59。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |..|分数 （竖式） 的第二个分离开来秒区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|可选秒的小数部分包含 1 到 7 十进制数字。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 组件`s`必须共同指定大于或等于的时间间隔且小于或等于。The components of `s` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法尝试分析`s`通过每个区域性特定的格式用于当前区域性。The method tries to parse `s` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the current culture. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法来创建对象从有效字符串，还可以指示在分析操作已失败，因为时间跨度字符串无效。The following example uses the method to create objects from valid strings and to indicate when the parse operation has failed because the time span string is invalid. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/TryParse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/TryParse1.vb#1)]

block.para:
在某些情况下，当要分析的字符串中的时间间隔组件包含多个七个数字，分析操作中成功[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]和早期版本可能失败并引发中[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]，下面的示例说明了此方案。In some cases, when a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations that succeed in the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], The following example illustrates this scenario.
[!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/tryparsefailure1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/tryparsefailure1.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像是方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `input`参数包含一个时间间隔规范形式：The `input` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*] [-] { *d* | *d*。*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | *d*.*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 一个从列表中选择的替代项括在大括号 （{和}） 和由竖线分隔 (|) 是必需的。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表描述每个元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |-|可选的负号，指示负。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|范围从 0 到 10675199 天。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |..|小时分隔天区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|小时数，范围从 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|区分区域性的时间分隔符符号。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 固定格式使用冒号 (":") 字符。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分钟数，范围从 0 到 59。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|可选的秒，范围从 0 到 59。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |..|分数 （竖式） 的第二个分离开来秒区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|可选秒的小数部分包含 1 到 7 十进制数字。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 组件`input`必须共同指定大于或等于的时间间隔且小于或等于。The components of `input` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法尝试分析`input`通过每个区域性特定的格式用于指定的区域性`formatProvider`。The method tries to parse `input` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the culture specified by `formatProvider`. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供返回字符串的格式的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A对象，用于定义返回字符串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、使用与当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个数组对象，并在调用中使用每个对象方法，以便分析的字符串数组中的元素。The following example defines an array of objects, and uses each object in calls to the method to parse the elements in a string array. 该示例说明如何特定区域性的约定影响格式设置操作。The example illustrates how the conventions of a specific culture influence the formatting operation. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/tryparse2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/tryparse2.vb#2)]

block.para:
在某些情况下，当要分析的字符串中的时间间隔组件包含多个七个数字，分析操作成功，并且返回中[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]和早期版本可能会失败并返回中[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]，下面的示例阐释了这种情况。In some cases, when a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations that succeed and return in the [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions may fail and return in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], The following example illustrates this scenario.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析的时间间隔，它必须是定义的格式的字符串表示`format`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法类似于是方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `format`参数是一个字符串，包含单个标准格式说明符或一个或多个定义的所需的格式的自定义格式说明符`input`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法使用由指定的区域性的约定`formatProvider`仅当`format`是一种标准字符串设置其值为"g"或"G"格式。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if `format` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义的输入字符串的确切格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔内的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供返回字符串的格式的区域性特定信息，如果`format`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A对象，用于定义返回字符串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、使用与当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法，以便分析的时间间隔使用各种格式字符串和区域性的多个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.TryParseExact#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.tryparseexact/cs/tryparseexactexample1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParseExact#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.tryparseexact/vb/tryparseexactexample1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析的时间间隔，它必须是定义由一个由指定的格式字符串的格式的字符串表示`formats`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by one of the format strings specified by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法类似于是方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `formats`参数是一个字符串数组，其元素由单一的标准格式说明符或一个或多个定义的所需的格式的自定义格式说明符组成`input`。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必须精确对应于的成员`formats`分析操作成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 分析操作尝试匹配`input`中的所有元素`formats`从数组中的第一个元素开始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法使用由指定的区域性的约定`formatProvider`参数仅当格式字符串用于分析`input`是一种标准字符串设置其值为"g"或"G"格式。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义的输入字符串的确切格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔内的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供返回字符串的格式的区域性特定信息，如果格式字符串用于分析`input`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A对象，用于定义返回字符串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、使用与当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法将转换到的字符串数组的每个元素值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 该示例通过使用法语-法国 ("FR-FR") 区域性的格式设置约定解释字符串。The example interprets the strings by using the formatting conventions of the French - France ("fr-FR") culture. 字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规长格式的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，该示例更改时间间隔分析方法在其中解释有一位数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，有一位数字解释为时间间隔的天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h`自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为的小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 有关此更改后才能生效，请注意，`%h`自定义格式字符串必须位于之前中的其他格式字符串`formats`数组。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析的时间间隔，它必须是定义的格式的字符串表示`format`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法类似于是方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `format`参数是一个字符串，包含单个标准格式说明符或一个或多个定义的所需的格式的自定义格式说明符`input`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供返回字符串的格式的区域性特定信息，如果`format`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A对象，用于定义返回字符串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、使用与当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`参数会影响使用自定义格式字符串分析的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否`input`负号存在时才被解释为负时间间隔 ()，或是否始终解释为负时间间隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用，`format`必须包含文本的负号符号 (如"\\-") 为成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法，以便分析的时间间隔使用各种格式字符串和区域性的多个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. 它还使用要解释为负时间间隔的每个字符串值。It also uses the value to interpret each string as a negative time interval. 输出示例中的阐释了样式会影响返回值，仅当将它用于自定义格式字符串。The output from the example illustrates that the style affects the return value only when it is used with custom format strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析的时间间隔，它必须是定义由一个由指定的格式字符串的格式的字符串表示`formats`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by one of the format strings specified by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法类似于是方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `formats`参数是一个字符串数组，其元素由单一的标准格式说明符或一个或多个定义的所需的格式的自定义格式说明符组成`input`。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必须精确对应于的成员`formats`分析操作成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 分析操作尝试匹配`input`中的所有元素`formats`从数组中的第一个元素开始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法使用由指定的区域性的约定`formatProvider`参数仅当格式字符串用于分析`input`是一种标准字符串设置其值为"g"或"G"格式。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义的输入字符串的确切格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔内的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供返回字符串的格式的区域性特定信息，如果格式字符串用于分析`input`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - A代表其格式设置约定才会反映在返回的字符串的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回字符串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A对象，用于定义返回字符串的格式。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`、使用与当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`参数会影响使用自定义格式字符串分析的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否`input`负号存在时才被解释为负时间间隔 ()，或是否始终解释为负时间间隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用，`format`必须包含文本的负号符号 (如"\\-") 为成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法将转换到的字符串数组的每个元素值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规长格式的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，该示例更改时间间隔分析方法在其中解释有一位数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，有一位数字解释为时间间隔的天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h`自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为的小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 有关此更改后才能生效，请注意，`%h`自定义格式字符串必须位于之前中的其他格式字符串`formats`数组。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. 另请注意从输出的仅在使用此格式说明符分析字符串时，才使用方法调用中指定的标志。Also note from the output that the flag specified in the method call is used only when parsing a string with this format specifier.
